item.title: RESEARCH
item.description: The Kids Are All Right: Parental Job Loss and Children’s Academic Achievement (JMP) This paper investigates the effect of parental layoff on children’s academic achievement in grades 4, 7, and 10, using administrative data from British Columbia. I find no significant effects on children’s test scores due to parental job loss. I also find that matching only on parent/household level variables can still lead to selection into layoff on unobservables that are correlated with children’s academic ability.
